text: <@U02F8TTPU|marissa> has joined the channel
I'm jamming a bit on Vroom this morning, checking in the latest assets from Trent and hopefully making some progress on one of the TODOs
sounds good marissa, thanks! kat is focused on iotas at the moment i believe but will be back on vroom when that wraps up

I have a UX question about the add child registration form. Should we be able to bulk-add children (i.e. a new registration form pops up inline every time you touch the Add Another Child button, even if you're currently in the middle of adding a child) or should we make Add Another Child disappear when we're editing, so we have to submit before adding the next one?
<@U02618EV1|gaston> has left the channel
want to see what <@U026PLK4S> thinks, but I feel like it'd be better and less of a potential rabbit hole if we limited it forcing submission before adding another
if for no other reason than you could just keep hitting add child and end up with a bunch of empty boxes
as long as you can delete, I'm not as worried about people adding 5 empty children as I am the "add child" button disappearing and re-appearing.
the biggest goal in all of this is to let people know they can add more children, if I see that button, and start adding Emma, what will I think if I see it disappear?
fair point
makes sense. we could disable that button while a child is currently being edited, but disabled elements are frustrating and waste screen space.
just wanted to make sure I'm on the right track! thanks
think it might also be a good idea to take a look at the iOS version
do you mean, disabled until all the fields are entered?
we should be pushing for consistency
I was just going to say the same thing <@U026103R3>  - kat and marissa should spend atleast a few minutes checking out the iOS version
yeah, i like what we've got going there
agreed, <@U0289USNA> i'm in a meeting at the moment, do you have an iOS device that has the latest build?
BRED should be loaded up and sitting around somewhere
and in practice, it's not as much of a rabbit hole as you may expect
^ agree with that for sure
sounds great, I'll look around for it
<@U02F8TTPU>: might be sitting on the white shelf behind the walnut table
if not, i can help find it right when this meeting ends
BRED has been found, updated to latest and given to marissa
awesome, thanks guys!

In the iOS app, when adding a new child, there's no error if the date is not set. The child seems to get a random birthday?
<@U0261PCRQ> thats probably an artifact of us having to get around an apple requirement
but good call
we should probably log that as a bug
